humanum_full_description_en:
" Jie " is like a person sitting on knees, "å›—" represents the boundary. Archeological excavations in Xiacheng City Guo Duo is square, which can be proved (see Xu Zhongshu), so the original meaning of " yi " refers to people living together The place. "Release name. "Shi Zhou Guo": "Yi, also known as people gathering." In addition, the ancients valued the capital of the country, and regarded the " capital " as the representative of the " national ". The names of countries and cities are often the same. For example, after Pangeng moved its capital to Yin in the Shang Dynasty, the Shang Dynasty was also called " Yin ". Therefore, " yi " is commonly referred to as " country ", which implies the capital. Oracle and Bronze inscriptions are often referred to as Dayi Shang and Tianyi Shang, which means Shangguo. Inscriptions such as "Cai (in) Dayi Shang" ("Compilation" 36530); inscriptions such as ğ£„°Zun: "King Yu Jue is also against Dayi Shang." "Shang Shu. Zhou Shu: "Weichen attached to Dayi Zhou." Oracle bone inscriptions are also used as names.

Bronze inscriptions are used as clan names and names, and also mean the city. Huanzi Mengjianghu: "the capital of the people"; also used as a regional unit: "The city of Hou's Yi (given) is two hundred and ninety years Jiuyi".

Warring States characters are mostly used as place names.

"Shuowen": "The town, the country. From the å›—; the system of the first king, there are big and small, from the åª. All the people of the town are from the town."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The word " yi " in the Jiajin inscription starts from "å›—" (the walls of Xia Shangcheng are mostly square) and from " jie " (people sitting on knees ). The original meaning refers to a place where people live together.

["Guangyun" Yu Jiqie, enter the arrest, film. ]
(1) The capital, the capital of the country.
(2) In ancient times, it was called the Hou State.
(3) Refers to the capital of the ancient ancestral temple without Xianjun.
(4) Refers to the old capital.
(5) Places where people live. Da Yue Du, Xiao Yue Yi. Refers to villages and towns in general.
(6) The establishment unit of the ancient common people. Five schools are the track, and the sixth track is the eup.
(7) The establishment unit of the ancient common people. Sanpeng is the li, and Wuli is the city.
(8) The nickname of the old county.
(9) Enclose the city to live in; build the city.
(10) The fief, the fief.
(11) Especially referring to the fiefs of queens and princesses.
(12) Ancient regional unit.
(13) Through "Liao". Melancholic appearance.
(14) See "Yiyi".
